Title: Business & Data Analyst
HTML:
Dove lavorerai

Per la nostra sede di Milano cerchiamo candidati interessati ad un percorso professionale all'interno della Direzione Generation & Energy Management.


Su cosa lavorerai

La persona che stiamo cercando avr√† la responsabilit√† per le seguenti attivit√†:

  • analizzare i dati;
  • identificare inefficienze di processo;
  • proporre soluzioni e monitorare i progressi;
  • collaborazione con le altre aree di business nei progetti di sviluppo di modelli, strumenti e applicazioni volti al continuo miglioramento dei processi.


Cosa pu√≤ esserti utile per valutare se candidarti

  • Laurea in Informatica, Economia, Ingegneria materie STEM;
  • Perfetta conoscenza del pacchetto Office;
  • Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di programmazione (R, Python, Qlik, ...);
  • Conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese;
  • Spirito di iniziativa;
  • Capacit√† di lavoro in team;
  • Ottime capacit√† relazionali.


La tua sede di lavoro

Lavorerai nel nostro HQs di Milano in Via A. Algardi 4 insieme al resto del tuo team di riferimento. Ci impegniamo a favorire il tuo work-life balance e quindi avrai la possibilit√†, se lo desideri, di lavorare anche in modalit√† ibrida organizzandoti con il tuo team.


Sorgenia

Nati nel 1999, siamo una Green Tech Energy Company e oggi il principale operatore energetico privato nazionale.


Scopri di pi√π su Sorgenia su www.sorgenia.it.


Cosa significa far parte di Sorgenia

Cerchiamo nuovi colleghi che, con spirito pionieristico e innovativo, siano pronti a gestire con proattivit√† e concretezza progetti sfidanti contribuendo alla continua crescita di Sorgenia.


In Sorgenia offriamo l‚Äôopportunit√† di imparare ogni giorno attraverso percorsi di formazione continua e eventi interni informali; siamo attenti al benessere delle nostre persone e per questo offriamo flessibilit√† oraria, smart working e una palestra aziendale se vuoi tenerti in forma.


Se vuoi scoprire cos‚Äôaltro offriamo in Sorgenia, candidati, non vediamo l‚Äôora di conoscerti!

Title: Data Analyst II (Remote)
Description:
Agile Lab, a leading data engineering company known for its pioneering work in Data Mesh, Data Management, and numerous distributed technologies, invites applications for the position of Data Analyst II. With a robust track record since 2013 and a dynamic team of over 130 professionals, we cherish an international mindset.

Discover more about our progressive culture and innovative projects by visiting our handbook.

The role

We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical Data Analyst II to join our team. You will be responsible for understanding and interpreting the needs of a modern enterprise, designing and implementing advanced analytical solutions. This will include interfacing with stakeholders to translate functional requirements into technical specifications, designing and implementing data flows on Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDWH) systems or Data Lakes. Mastery of one or more SQL dialects and knowledge of how to operate effectively on EDWH systems will be necessary.

You will also need to be able to create data marts and dashboards that effectively represent the information and KPIs extracted from the data.

RAL

‚Ç¨ 38.5K - 48.5K

Responsibilities


Actively collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and translate functional requirements into technical specifications, ensuring proper implementation of use cases.
Data flow implementation: design and implement new data flows on EDWH or Data Lake to meet specific business requirements, identifying and integrating necessary data sources.
Data cleaning and preparation: conduct data preparation and cleaning activities to ensure the quality and reliability of the data used in analyses.
Data quality techniques implementation: apply techniques and processes to ensure data integrity and reliability through quality control.
Data model creation: develop specific data models for identified use cases, transforming input data into formats suitable for analysis and insight generation.
Collaboration with dashboarding experts: work closely with dashboarding and data visualization experts to implement effective dashboards and reporting, presenting results in a clear and engaging manner.


Requirements


Knowledge of Italian language is required;
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 2 years of experience in transformation, data modeling, and data analysis on Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDWH) systems, preferably with skills on platforms like Azure Synapse and Teradata.
Experience with Databricks or Snowflake considered a plus.
Technical knowledge: in-depth knowledge of SQL language and its dialects, related to at least one EDWH system. Proficiency in Data Modeling methodologies and principles of Data Visualization. Knowledge of PowerBI is considered a plus.
Good Knowledge of Python;
Analytical skills: ability to map business requirements to data models and KPIs, ensuring accurate translation and a deep understanding of business needs.
Knowledge of business processes in at least one of the following areas: insurance, telco, banking, or utility.
Effective communication: skill in maintaining ongoing dialogue with stakeholders throughout all phases of the project, ensuring continuous alignment and a clear understanding of requirements.


We offer


Real work life balance;
Training monthly budget (time and money);
A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level;
Support of a buddy, as a guide in choosing the most suitable experiences for your ambitions;
Benefits and corporate welfare programs: company prizes and welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work;
Agile Nomads experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad;
Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you;
The opportunity to attend one conference per year;
Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are;
Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.


This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Agile Lab, a leading data engineering company known for its pioneering work in Data Mesh, Data Management, and numerous distributed technologies, invites applications for the position of Data Analyst II. With a robust track record since 2013 and a dynamic team of over 130 professionals, we cherish an international mindset.

Discover more about our progressive culture and innovative projects by visiting our handbook.

The role

We are seeking a detail-oriented, analytical Data Analyst II to join our team. You will be responsible for understanding and interpreting the needs of a modern enterprise, designing and implementing advanced analytical solutions. This will include interfacing with stakeholders to translate functional requirements into technical specifications, designing and implementing data flows on Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDWH) systems or Data Lakes. Mastery of one or more SQL dialects and knowledge of how to operate effectively on EDWH systems will be necessary.

You will also need to be able to create data marts and dashboards that effectively represent the information and KPIs extracted from the data.

RAL

‚Ç¨ 38.5K - 48.5K

Responsibilities

  • Actively collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and translate functional requirements into technical specifications, ensuring proper implementation of use cases.
  • Data flow implementation: design and implement new data flows on EDWH or Data Lake to meet specific business requirements, identifying and integrating necessary data sources.
  • Data cleaning and preparation: conduct data preparation and cleaning activities to ensure the quality and reliability of the data used in analyses.
  • Data quality techniques implementation: apply techniques and processes to ensure data integrity and reliability through quality control.
  • Data model creation: develop specific data models for identified use cases, transforming input data into formats suitable for analysis and insight generation.
  • Collaboration with dashboarding experts: work closely with dashboarding and data visualization experts to implement effective dashboards and reporting, presenting results in a clear and engaging manner.

Requirements

  • Knowledge of Italian language is required;
  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.
  • At least 2 years of experience in transformation, data modeling, and data analysis on Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDWH) systems, preferably with skills on platforms like Azure Synapse and Teradata.
  • Experience with Databricks or Snowflake considered a plus.
  • Technical knowledge: in-depth knowledge of SQL language and its dialects, related to at least one EDWH system. Proficiency in Data Modeling methodologies and principles of Data Visualization. Knowledge of PowerBI is considered a plus.
  • Good Knowledge of Python;
  • Analytical skills: ability to map business requirements to data models and KPIs, ensuring accurate translation and a deep understanding of business needs.
  • Knowledge of business processes in at least one of the following areas: insurance, telco, banking, or utility.
  • Effective communication: skill in maintaining ongoing dialogue with stakeholders throughout all phases of the project, ensuring continuous alignment and a clear understanding of requirements.

We offer

  • Real work life balance;
  • Training monthly budget (time and money);
  • A structured career path with clear expectations and salary for each level;
  • Support of a buddy, as a guide in choosing the most suitable experiences for your ambitions;
  • Benefits and corporate welfare programs: company prizes and welcome pack with all the equipment you need to work;
  • Agile Nomads experience: opportunity to work for 2 weeks abroad;
  • Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you;
  • The opportunity to attend one conference per year;
  • Inclusive environment where you can be who you really are;
  • Stimulating environment oriented to growth, both professional and personal.

This position is open to all candidates, regardless of gender, and we strongly encourage applications from both male and female candidates pursuant to Art. 27 of Legislative Decree no. 198/2006, as well as those who identify themselves as non-binary or of any other kind. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Title: Stage - Data Analyst
Description:
Attraverso Edison Energia, controllata al 100% da Edison, siamo la societ√† commerciale del gruppo

impegnata nella vendita di energia elettrica, gas e servizi energetici a valore sia sul mercato italiano

B2B che B2C. Siamo leader fin dalla liberalizzazione del mercato sia per l‚Äôenergia elettrica che per il gas, gestendo oltre 1,5 milioni di clienti. Oggi √® un fornitore di qualit√† di energia e gas e una prima scelta per servizi innovativi per la casa e l‚Äôefficienza energetica.




Nell'ambito della Divisione Gas & Power Market - Direzione Finance‚Äì all‚Äôinterno della funzione Planning&Performance, ricerchiamo un Data Analyst, specialista in scripting e visualizzazione a supporto del team Consolidato & Credit Monitoring.




Principali attivit√†




Potrai contribuire al successo della funzione Planning & Performance, dedicandoti alle seguenti attivit√† di supporto:




‚Ä¢ Scripting: definizione e implementazione delle regole di estrazione e visualizzazione dati attraverso la creazione di script per configurare e personalizzare logiche di analisi e di esposizione dei dati

‚Ä¢ Raccolta dati: identificare fonti dati, sviluppare query per estrazioni automatizzate e garantire aggiornamenti regolari

‚Ä¢ Data cleaning: preparare e affinare i dataset per sviluppare e applicare i modelli di analisi

‚Ä¢ Data modelling & data visualization: progettare strutture dati e visualizzazioni che permettano di monitorare nuovi KPI operativi e strategici. Dal dato grezzo, all‚Äôanalisi del KPI fino all‚Äôesposizione delle evidenze emerse

‚Ä¢ Sintesi e presentazione dei risultati: razionalizzazione e rappresentazione sintetica della evidenze condivisibili con il top management




Profilo ideale




‚Ä¢ Laurea in discipline quantitative (matematica, statistica, informatica, ingegneria, economia)

‚Ä¢ Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di Qliksense, in particolare nello sviluppo di script, formule e dashboard customizzate verr√† considerata canale preferenziale

‚Ä¢ Conoscenza linguaggio di programmazione SQL

‚Ä¢ Approccio critico, curioso e flessibile

‚Ä¢ Atteggiamento proattivo e volto al problem solving

‚Ä¢ Capacit√† di analisi, interpretazione e presentazione dati

‚Ä¢ Conoscenza di MS Excel e Power Point

‚Ä¢ Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese verr√† considerata un plus




Perch√© entrare a far parte di Edison?




‚Ä¢ Retribuzione competitiva

‚Ä¢ Percorsi di On-boarding e formazione personalizzati

‚Ä¢ Communities: Young Community, associazione sportiva e volontariato

‚Ä¢ Welfare Aziendale Edison Per Te (Buoni spesa, shopping e carburante; sport e benessere, viaggi, cultura e tempo libero; istruzione e formazione; assistenza alla famiglia; mutui, trasporto pubblico, salute)

‚Ä¢ Benefit (previdenza integrativa, assistenza sanitaria, sconti sui servizi energia, supporto housing e tanto altro)

‚Ä¢ Opportunit√† di mobilit√† interna e internazionale

‚Ä¢ Mensa & Caffetteria

‚Ä¢ Orario Flessibile e Smart working




Sede di lavoro: Milano, Foro Buonaparte




Diventiamo insieme l‚Äôenergia che cambia tutto!




Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi del decreto legislativo 11 aprile 2006 n. 198 ‚ÄúCodice delle pari opportunit√† tra uomo e donna‚Äù e a persone di tutte le et√† e nazionalit√†, ai sensi della Direttiva 2000/78/CE ‚ÄúParit√† di trattamento in materia di occupazione‚Äù.

Title: Data Analyst Marketing and Growth - Italy
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION


Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisions to boost Glovo presence and orders
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base focusing on traffic, conversion and retention rates and leveraging on levers such as pricing, promotions, events, CRM and other marketing levers etc
Drive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actions
Identify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitability
Take ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Assist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data, and communicate and simplify concepts to the audience's needs
Drive clarity and solve ambiguity using data-driven approaches
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products, identify growth opportunities, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Bachelor's degree in Math, Engineering, Business, Stats, Quantitative field or Business
SQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plus
Ninja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a must
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation)
A hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!
Proficiency in English
Strong consumer understanding skills


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Junior - Data Analyst Insurance Solutions
HTML:
Junior ‚Äì Data Analyst Insurace Solutions

Stiamo cercando una figura junior da poter inserire all'interno del team di Insurance Solutions di Deloitte (sede di Milano con modalit√† di lavoro Hybrid).

Il business di riferimento si occupa di trasformare e revisionare i modelli operativi delle istituzioni finanziarie supportate, a seguito di esigenze che possono nascere dal business di riferimento/dal contesto di mercato del cliente/da adeguamenti dettati dalle normative in ambito assicurativo.

Your Role

La risorsa Junior sar√† inserita in un team di lavoro, affiancando colleghi senior e occupandosi di:

  • Supportare con il tuo team i C-level dell‚Äôazienda cliente in attivit√† volte alla massimizzazione della profittabilit√†, all‚Äôimplementazione di nuovi business model, alla definizione di strategie di innovazione tecnologica per la realizzazione di modelli operativi efficienti e competitivi;
  • Sviluppare e gestire l‚Äôinnovazione strategica e di strategie di cost reduction e optimization;
  • Razionalizzare il patrimonio informativo aziendale;
  • Merger and Post merger Integration di Istituzioni finanziarie;
  • Ottimizzare i processi core in ambito bancario (Corporate Governance Transformation, Credito, Finanza, Commerciale, Accounting Transformation) e in ambito assicurativo (Corporate Governance Transformation, Underwriting and Product Management, Distribution, Claims) anche grazie all‚Äôutilizzo di RPA, AI, Blockchain, Digital transformation.

Winning Requirements

  • Laurea triennale/specialistica in Ingegneria Gestionale, Ingegneria Informatica, Scienze dell‚ÄôInformazione o discipline tecnico/scientifiche affini;
  • Conoscenza dei concetti di gestione dei sistemi informativi a supporto dei processi aziendali e comprensione delle basi dello sviluppo software (programmazione ad oggetti, sviluppo applicazioni web, gestione dei database);
  • Conoscenza della basi dati relazionali, interrogazione database, SQL, analisi Dati;
  • Conoscenza (gradita) piattaforma Microsoft/Oracle database e Report oriented (MS SQL SERVER, MS POWERBI);
  • Conoscenza (gradita) tool di ETL: IBM Data Stage, MS Integration Services etc;
  • Conoscenza degli strumenti di office automation con particolare riferimento all‚Äôutilizzo evoluto delle funzionalit√† di Excel a supporto delle attivit√† di analisi dei dati.

Make An Impact That Matters

Deloitte √® un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo √® supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilit√† √® un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualit√† legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la societ√†. Scopri di pi√π sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinch√© siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un‚Äôorganizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all‚Äôinterno e all‚Äôesterno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the Company - For an Italian company, based in Milan (>500 employees), operating in the media and entertainment industry, we are looking for a Junior Junior Business Intelligence Analyst.




About the Role - Duties and Responsibilities

Analytical Support and Development of Key Proposals (Prospects & Partners)

Conduct comprehensive research and analysis to gather relevant insights and intelligence required for proposal development.
Assist in data-driven decision-making to inform proposal creation and strategy.
Collaborate in the planning and development of partnership territories, narratives, and concepts with a focus on analytical rigor.
Identify and implement analytical solutions to improve team outputs and overall effectiveness.




Keeping the Department Updated on Market Trends and Insights

Conduct regular analysis of the latest marketing trends and insights.
Develop initiatives to disseminate analytical insights to the department, helping colleagues understand their relevance and impact on commercial proposals and marketing activations.
Provide analytical support to inspire innovation and maintain a competitive advantage within the team.




Support in Strategic Team and Departmental Projects

Assist in the development and execution of key departmental projects and initiatives assigned by senior leadership.
Support project progress, ensuring adherence to dynamic timelines and deadlines through effective data analysis.




Qualifications

1-2 years of experience in an agency, brand, or rights holder working in sports marketing and/or commercial partnership development.
Strong knowledge and understanding of the commercial football, sports, and entertainment landscape.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization software.
Proven ability to develop analytically driven, professionally structured, and presented proposals & supporting sales materials.
Knowledge and understanding of core marketing competencies and principles.
Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.
Results-driven with a keen eye for data and metrics.
Ability to manage a varied project workload in a dynamic environment and collaborate with senior stakeholders.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with internal and external stakeholders.
Proactive approach to identifying and solving problems using analytical methods.
Ability to work effectively in a cross-team/interdepartmental environment and positively influence peers and senior team leads.

  • Proven ability to develop analytically driven, professionally structured, and presented proposals & supporting sales materials.
  • Knowledge and understanding of core marketing competencies and principles.
  • Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.
  • Results-driven with a keen eye for data and metrics.
  • Ability to manage a varied project workload in a dynamic environment and collaborate with senior stakeholders.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Proactive approach to identifying and solving problems using analytical methods.
  • Ability to work effectively in a cross-team/interdepartmental environment and positively influence peers and senior team leads.

Migliorare la governance del dato

Title: Data Analyst (L.68/99)
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as a Data Analyst (L.68/99) and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, Marketing and Business Development teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission


Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product and business line through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze and drive. Analyze and interpret datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product and processes enhancements.
Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Cooperate. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data into broader business strategies.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios.
Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

üôÜüèª Join an international team to grow with

üè° Hybrid working policy

üçΩÔ∏è Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

üåê Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

‚≠ê Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

üöÄ Own part of Satispay‚Äôs success with our Stock Option Plan

üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Gear up with our tech equipment

ü•≥ Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a remote technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

Title: Data Analyst - Credit Collection (f/m/x)
HTML:
Position Overview

Deutsche Bank offre servizi e prodotti di banca commerciale, banca d'investimento, transaction banking, asset e wealth management ad aziende, governi ed enti pubblici, investitori istituzionali, piccole e medie imprese, famiglie e privati. Deutsche Bank √® la banca leader in Germania, con un forte posizionamento in Europa e una presenza significativa nelle Americhe e nell'area Asia Pacifico.

L‚ÄôItalia rappresenta il suo primo mercato europeo, dopo la Germania, e l‚ÄôIstituto √® tra i pi√π importanti gruppi internazionali presenti nel Paese.

La Risorsa verr√† inserita all‚Äôinterno del Team Collection di Milano. Obiettivo del team √® quello di gestire le attivit√† di recupero crediti riferite al portafoglio retail di DB SpA.

La Risorsa, ricoprendo il ruolo di Data Analyst, verr√† inserita all‚Äôinterno del Team Collection di Milano. Obiettivo del team √® quello di gestire le attivit√† di recupero crediti riferite al portafoglio retail di Deutsche Bank S.p.A.

La sede di lavoro potr√† essere Milano, oppure Padova.

Le responsabilit√† assegnate sono:

  • Creare nuovo reporting e manutenere l‚Äôattuale dashboard di monitoraggio del portafoglio apportandone costante miglioramenti;
  • Analizzare l‚Äôandamento dei principali KPI oltre ad approfondire e comprendere gli eventuali motivi di scostamento;
  • Monitorare il cost/income ratio dei diversi canali di recupero;
  • Verificare il rispetto delle assunzioni utilizzate in fase di forecasting;
  • Condurre analisi ad hoc per indirizzare le decisioni di gestione ed ottimizzazione del portafoglio;
  • Partecipare a progetti inerenti l‚Äôambito di competenza dell‚ÄôUnit√† Organizzativa tra cui UTP ed NPE;
  • Supportare l‚Äôesecuzione di attivit√† di controllo sulla conformit√† dei processi;
  • Realizzare presentazioni per il Management;
  • Relazionarsi con gli altri team dell‚ÄôUnit√† Organizzativa oltre agli stakeholders locali e globali.



    • Le competenze richieste sono:

    • Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica o Ingegneria;
    • Pregressa esperienza di almeno 3 anni in ruoli analoghi, preferibilmente in organizzazione strutturate in ambito finanziario;
    • Avanzato utilizzo di SAS/SQL anche applicato alla creazione di modelli;
    • Avanzato utilizzo del Pacchetto Office;
    • Ottimo inglese
    • Passione per l‚Äôanalisi e la gestione dei dati;
    • Spiccato orientamento al risultato e al problem solving;
    • Autonomia nell‚Äôorganizzazione del lavoro;
    • Pensiero analitico e capacit√† di sintesi;
    • Buone doti relazionali e negoziali


    Well-being & Benefits

    Ci impegniamo a fornire un ambiente di lavoro che metta al centro lo sviluppo delle persone, rispettando la loro unicit√† e i loro bisogni.

    Sosteniamo i nostri dipendenti a prendersi cura del proprio benessere mentale e fisico invitandoli a riflettere sui temi della mental health, pianificando webinar, incontri dedicati e offrendo loro una Personal Support Line. Garantiamo un posto di lavoro smart e innovativo oltre ad un programma di assistenza sanitaria, welfare e convenzioni aziendali a supporto di percorsi di prevenzione e cura della propria salute fisica.

    Crediamo fortemente nell‚Äôinclusione per ampliare nuove prospettive e rafforzare la fiducia in s√© stessi migliorando il benessere collettivo. A supporto del work-life balance mettiamo a disposizione permessi retribuiti di congedo parentale e altri strumenti per favorire il Family Caring.

    Forniamo soluzioni per sostenere la sicurezza finanziaria, tra cui il Fondo Pensione Integrativo, la Polizza Long Term Care e condizioni agevolate per i nostri prodotti finanziari.

    We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

    Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

    We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

Title: Network Data Scientist
Description:
What you'll do:

You will work in a team of Network Planners, Developers and Data Scientists to support the development of modelling and analytics capabilities for planning Sky‚Äôs Mobile and Voice network infrastructure and to drive the network strategy.




This is a highly dynamic role that will allow you to grow multidisciplinary skills in the Data Science, Network Modelling and Cloud Development domains.




Your main responsibilities will be:




Data Engineering and Analysis

Ingest and process network and commercial data

Create regular and ad hoc reports

Communicate requirements to the software team

Network Modelling

Identify network capacity limits and network metrics

Create capacity and economic network models

Generate capacity and budget forecasts

Network Analytics

Apply data science methodologies to analyse and improve network performance and cost efficiency

Develop Insights to support commercial objectives and present analysis/plans to relevant stakeholders up to UK CTO




What you'll bring:

You will have good knowledge and experience (gained in the industry) in the data science area. Alternatively, you have industry network experience combined with good exposure to data analytics.

Essential requirements:

BSc in Maths, Statistics, Data Science (or similar)

Proven experience with managing and analysing time series data

Hands on programming skills in Python and SQL

Familiarity with Agile methodologies

Excellent presentation skills

Stakeholder management experience

Desirable requirements

PhD in Computer Science or similar

Experience capacity panning virtual appliances

Familiarity with large packet core and mobile networks

Working experience deploying solutions on public cloud




Team Overview:

The Network Software and Data Science team, part of Sky‚Äôs Engineering Division, takes a data-driven approach towards meeting network planning goals, including capacity planning, performance planning and network economics. We develop insights which reinforce planning decisions and support wider commercial objectives.

Title: Planning and Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!

WHY JOIN US
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
*International, engaging, and supportive working environment.
*Global onboarding process.
*Bespoke training and development programs accessible to all.
*Competitive welfare and benefits package.

DRIVE YOUR FUTURE
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated professional to join our Methods & Systems team. If you are eager to work in a collaborative, innovative, and growth-oriented environment, we want you to be a part of our team. Working at Pirelli is an opportunity to develop your professional knowledge; from day one, you will gain hands-on experience and grow your skills.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES
*Supporting Reporting, Methods & Systems team during yearly budget and monthly closures through rolling forecast and strategic plans.
*Analyzing profitability data and checking their coherence and consistence across all the relevant dimensions of analysis to ensure adequate business explanations.
*Defining and monitoring economic and financial KPIs to support business decisions.
*Sharing with local subsidiaries P&L information generated within the controlling systems.
*Monitoring local subsidiaries profitability according to Group Transfer Pricing Policy and in collaboration with Tax department.
*Designing, developing, and testing new systems for internal controlling. Maintaining systems functionalities in collaboration with IT department.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
*Master's degree in Economics, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
*Fluency in English and Italian.
*2 years of experience in a consultancy firm.
*Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, good understanding of SAP.
*Knowledge of Oracle ERP tools for Enterprise Performance Management.
*Familiarity with statistical tools for data analysis.

HTML:
Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!

WHY JOIN US
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
*International, engaging, and supportive working environment.
*Global onboarding process.
*Bespoke training and development programs accessible to all.
*Competitive welfare and benefits package.

DRIVE YOUR FUTURE
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated professional to join our Methods & Systems team. If you are eager to work in a collaborative, innovative, and growth-oriented environment, we want you to be a part of our team. Working at Pirelli is an opportunity to develop your professional knowledge; from day one, you will gain hands-on experience and grow your skills.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES
*Supporting Reporting, Methods & Systems team during yearly budget and monthly closures through rolling forecast and strategic plans.
*Analyzing profitability data and checking their coherence and consistence across all the relevant dimensions of analysis to ensure adequate business explanations.
*Defining and monitoring economic and financial KPIs to support business decisions.
*Sharing with local subsidiaries P&L information generated within the controlling systems.
*Monitoring local subsidiaries profitability according to Group Transfer Pricing Policy and in collaboration with Tax department.
*Designing, developing, and testing new systems for internal controlling. Maintaining systems functionalities in collaboration with IT department.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
*Master's degree in Economics, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field.
*Fluency in English and Italian.
*2 years of experience in a consultancy firm.
*Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, good understanding of SAP.
*Knowledge of Oracle ERP tools for Enterprise Performance Management.
*Familiarity with statistical tools for data analysis.
*Good communication skills, team working and a proactive approach to problem solving.

WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
*Good communication skills and team working.
*Proactive approach to problem solving.
*A meticulous approach to data management and analysis.

APPLY NOW, DRIVE YOUR FUTURE!

Title: Data Analyst | MILANO
Description:
Descrizione azienda

Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attivit√†, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Posizione

Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza pu√≤ davvero fare la differenza.

Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

Il tuo ruolo riguarda l‚Äôanalisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.

Come?


realizzando report su misura;
utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come Data Analyst all‚Äôinterno del team Data Driven Insights. La struttura ha lo scopo di svolgere le analisi dati a supporto delle attivit√† e delle iniziative del Marketing, delle Strutture di vendita, del Customer Service, supportando nell‚Äôidentificazione delle strategie di business ottimali delle Societ√† della Business Unit Mercato.¬†

Per quale Business Unit

L‚Äôattivit√† della Business Unit Mercato √® finalizzata alla vendita al dettaglio di energia elettrica e di gas naturale ai clienti del mercato libero e alla commercializzazione ai clienti serviti in regime di tutela. Inoltre, si occupa di fornire servizi di efficienza energetica e di mobilit√† elettrica.

Ti occuperai di


Analisi strategiche a supporto delle decisioni del business, in particolare legate ai fenomeni contingenti di mercato. Aggiornamento periodico delle analisi, continuo adeguamento alle richieste dei clienti interni, proposizione di nuovi approfondimenti. Predisposizione delle viste e delle rappresentazioni per i SAL periodici
Sviluppo di nuovi report o viste sulla base dei requisiti espressi dai clienti interni, seguendo l‚Äôintero processo: dalla parte di analisi dei dati e degli aspetti tecnici alla presentazione dei risultati
Manutenzione evolutiva ed automazione di analisi/report esistenti
Sviluppo di codice per l‚Äôelaborazione automatica di dati estratti dalla Data Platform a supporto delle attivit√† di marketing e vendita della societ√† della BU Mercato e la presentazione dei risultati (analisi statistiche, test di ipotesi, studi di correlazione di variabili, valutazione degli intervalli di confidenza associati alle statistiche prodotte, calcolo di indicatori, variabili derivate e KPI di business, ‚Ä¶)


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in Statistica, Data Science, Matematica, Ingegneria
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni nella analisi e gestione dei dati, preferibilmente in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Esperienza consolidata del linguaggio SQL
Esperienza pratica di linguaggio R
Padronanza di tecniche di data visualisation
Ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto Office
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza di Power BI, esperienza pratica nell‚Äôuso di BigQuery su Google Cloud Platform ed esperienza pratica di linguaggio Python
Completano il profilo: attitudine al problem solving, proattivit√†, predisposizione al lavoro in team e alla condivisione delle informazioni e ottime doti comunicative e relazionali


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilit√†: settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa,¬†supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro:¬†promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversit√†.

La selezione √® rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Title: Junior Digital Analyst
Description:
A proposito di fifty-five:¬†

fifty-five √® una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.


fifty-five conta pi√π di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.


Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,¬† supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realt√† omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come Data Analyst all‚Äôinterno del team Data Driven Insights. La struttura ha lo scopo di svolgere le analisi dati a supporto delle attivit√† e delle iniziative del Marketing, delle Strutture di vendita, del Customer Service, supportando nell‚Äôidentificazione delle strategie di business ottimali delle Societ√† della Business Unit Mercato.¬†

Per quale Societ√†

L‚Äôattivit√† della Business Unit Mercato √® finalizzata alla vendita al dettaglio di energia elettrica e di gas naturale ai clienti del mercato libero e alla commercializzazione ai clienti serviti in regime di tutela. Inoltre, si occupa di fornire servizi di efficienza energetica e di mobilit√† elettrica.

Ti occuperai di


Analisi strategiche a supporto delle decisioni del business, in particolare legate ai fenomeni contingenti di mercato. Aggiornamento periodico delle analisi, continuo adeguamento alle richieste dei clienti interni, proposizione di nuovi approfondimenti. Predisposizione delle viste e delle rappresentazioni per i SAL periodici
Sviluppo di nuovi report o viste sulla base dei requisiti espressi dai clienti interni, seguendo l‚Äôintero processo: dalla parte di analisi dei dati e degli aspetti tecnici alla presentazione dei risultati
Manutenzione evolutiva ed automazione di analisi/report esistenti
Sviluppo di codice per l‚Äôelaborazione automatica di dati estratti dalla Data Platform a supporto delle attivit√† di marketing e vendita della societ√† della BU Mercato e la presentazione dei risultati (analisi statistiche, test di ipotesi, studi di correlazione di variabili, valutazione degli intervalli di confidenza associati alle statistiche prodotte, calcolo di indicatori, variabili derivate e KPI di business, ‚Ä¶)


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in Statistica, Data Science, Matematica, Ingegneria
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni nella analisi e gestione dei dati, preferibilmente in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, telecomunicazioni o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Esperienza consolidata del linguaggio SQL
Esperienza pratica di linguaggio R
Padronanza di tecniche di data visualisation
Ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto Office
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza di Power BI, esperienza pratica nell‚Äôuso di BigQuery su Google Cloud Platform ed esperienza pratica di linguaggio Python
Completano il profilo: attitudine al problem solving, proattivit√†, predisposizione al lavoro in team e alla condivisione delle informazioni e ottime doti comunicative e relazionali


Che cosa offriamo


Flessibilit√†: settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
Buoni pasto elettronici
Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa,¬†supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver,¬†offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti,¬†gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
Ambiente di lavoro:¬†promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull‚Äôetica e sulle pari opportunit√† garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversit√†.

Title: Network Data Scientist
Description:
What you'll do:

You will work in a team of Network Planners, Developers and Data Scientists to support the development of modelling and analytics capabilities for planning Sky‚Äôs Mobile and Voice network infrastructure and to drive the network strategy.




This is a highly dynamic role that will allow you to grow multidisciplinary skills in the Data Science, Network Modelling and Cloud Development domains.




Your main responsibilities will be:




Data Engineering and Analysis

Ingest and process network and commercial data

Create regular and ad hoc reports

Communicate requirements to the software team

Network Modelling

Identify network capacity limits and network metrics

Create capacity and economic network models

Generate capacity and budget forecasts

Network Analytics

Apply data science methodologies to analyse and improve network performance and cost efficiency

Develop Insights to support commercial objectives and present analysis/plans to relevant stakeholders up to UK CTO




What you'll bring:

You will have good knowledge and experience (gained in the industry) in the data science area. Alternatively, you have industry network experience combined with good exposure to data analytics.

Essential requirements:

BSc in Maths, Statistics, Data Science (or similar)

Proven experience with managing and analysing time series data

Hands on programming skills in Python and SQL

Familiarity with Agile methodologies

Excellent presentation skills

Stakeholder management experience

Desirable requirements

PhD in Computer Science or similar

Experience capacity panning virtual appliances

Familiarity with large packet core and mobile networks

Working experience deploying solutions on public cloud




Team Overview:

The Network Software and Data Science team, part of Sky‚Äôs Engineering Division, takes a data-driven approach towards meeting network planning goals, including capacity planning, performance planning and network economics. We develop insights which reinforce planning decisions and support wider commercial objectives.

Title: Stage - Data Analyst
Description:
Attraverso Edison Energia, controllata al 100% da Edison, siamo la societ√† commerciale del gruppo

impegnata nella vendita di energia elettrica, gas e servizi energetici a valore sia sul mercato italiano

B2B che B2C. Siamo leader fin dalla liberalizzazione del mercato sia per l‚Äôenergia elettrica che per il gas, gestendo oltre 1,5 milioni di clienti. Oggi √® un fornitore di qualit√† di energia e gas e una prima scelta per servizi innovativi per la casa e l‚Äôefficienza energetica.




Nell'ambito della Divisione Gas & Power Market - Direzione Finance‚Äì all‚Äôinterno della funzione Planning&Performance, ricerchiamo un Data Analyst, specialista in scripting e visualizzazione a supporto del team Consolidato & Credit Monitoring.




Principali attivit√†




Potrai contribuire al successo della funzione Planning & Performance, dedicandoti alle seguenti attivit√† di supporto:




‚Ä¢ Scripting: definizione e implementazione delle regole di estrazione e visualizzazione dati attraverso la creazione di script per configurare e personalizzare logiche di analisi e di esposizione dei dati

‚Ä¢ Raccolta dati: identificare fonti dati, sviluppare query per estrazioni automatizzate e garantire aggiornamenti regolari

‚Ä¢ Data cleaning: preparare e affinare i dataset per sviluppare e applicare i modelli di analisi

‚Ä¢ Data modelling & data visualization: progettare strutture dati e visualizzazioni che permettano di monitorare nuovi KPI operativi e strategici. Dal dato grezzo, all‚Äôanalisi del KPI fino all‚Äôesposizione delle evidenze emerse

‚Ä¢ Sintesi e presentazione dei risultati: razionalizzazione e rappresentazione sintetica della evidenze condivisibili con il top management




Profilo ideale




‚Ä¢ Laurea in discipline quantitative (matematica, statistica, informatica, ingegneria, economia)

‚Ä¢ Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di Qliksense, in particolare nello sviluppo di script, formule e dashboard customizzate verr√† considerata canale preferenziale

‚Ä¢ Conoscenza linguaggio di programmazione SQL

‚Ä¢ Approccio critico, curioso e flessibile

‚Ä¢ Atteggiamento proattivo e volto al problem solving

‚Ä¢ Capacit√† di analisi, interpretazione e presentazione dati

‚Ä¢ Conoscenza di MS Excel e Power Point

‚Ä¢ Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese verr√† considerata un plus




Perch√© entrare a far parte di Edison?




‚Ä¢ Retribuzione competitiva

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Customer Experience
Description:
Chi siamo

Manutan Italia √® la filiale italiana di una multinazionale francese di circa 2'500 dipendenti in Europa, specializzata nella vendita B2B di attrezzature e forniture per imprese, enti locali e professionisti.




Chi cerchiamo?

Per la filiale di Cinisello Balsamo, che conta circa 75 persone, siamo alla ricerca di un* data analyst junior con una forte attitudine analitica e competenze avanzate in Excel, per entrare a far parte del nostro team Marketing Italia. La persona avr√† un ruolo chiave nell‚Äôanalisi dei dati e nell‚Äôottimizzazione della customer experience e verr√† inserita con contratto di apprendistato.




Di cosa ti occuperai?

Analizzare i dati provenienti dai gestionali interni per mappare il ciclo di vita del cliente e sviluppare i relativi workflow.
Effettuare analisi avanzate su Excel per individuare trend e pattern di comportamento d‚Äôacquisto.
Supportare la strategia delle comunicazioni, basandosi sulla customer experience.
Partecipare alla selezione dei prodotti da promuovere, con azioni marketing mirate.




Cosa cerchiamo in te?

Forti capacit√† analitiche e problem-solving.
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e capacit√† di lavorare con grandi volumi di dati.
Inglese livello B2 o superiore.
Titolo di studio in discipline legate all‚Äôanalisi dei dati (Economia, Statistica, Data Science, Marketing Analytics o simili).
Approccio proattivo, curiosit√† e voglia di mettersi in gioco.

Non cerchiamo una grande esperienza pregressa, ma entusiasmo, curiosit√† e voglia di mettersi in gioco per trasformare i dati in insight strategici.




Cosa offriamo

Un ambiente dinamico e internazionale.
Un team collaborativo pronto a supportarti.
Equilibrio tra vita privata e professionale.
Formazione continua.
Contratto di apprendistato 3 anni.




Sede di lavoro Cinisello Balsamo (MI).




Perch√© lavorare in Manutan




Lavoriamo in un ambiente dinamico e siamo parte di un team pi√π grande che soddisfa le aspettative di migliaia di clienti ogni singolo giorno. Siamo persone aperte e promuoviamo l'individualit√† e la diversit√†. Questi sono solo alcuni dei motivi per cui siamo un'azienda certificata Great Place to Work.




La ricerca √® rivolta a candidati d'ambo i sessi, i cui dati saranno trattati per finalit√† di selezione in base alla normativa vigente.

Title: Data Collector
Description:
Anson McCade are pleased to be working with a leading AI SaaS business who have an urgent need for a Data Collection Consultant.




The role

We are seeking a detail-oriented individual to assist with in-store data collection and coordination. This role involves gathering and processing essential retail data at select locations in Milian, ensuring seamless communication with our engineering team. While the tasks are straightforward, the position plays a crucial role in the overall success of our project by providing accurate and timely insights from the field.




Key Responsibilities:

Conduct precise in-store data collection and validation processes.
Work independently at customer locations, gathering product and merchandising data.
Adapt to an evolving application with frequent updates.
Use a barcode scanner to collect product UPCs.
Review collected data for accuracy, identifying and correcting any errors.
Collaborate with the Solutions Engineering team to resolve data discrepancies.
Perform additional tasks as needed to support project success.




What You‚Äôll Need:

Authorized to work in the Italy
Proficiency in using apps on a tablet or smartphone.
Strong ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and remain reliable.
Interest in learning and contributing to a growing AI-driven company.
Reliable transportation (personal vehicle required for store visits).

Title: Data Analyst with AI
Description:
Overview

LoJack is looking for a candidate for the position of Data Analyst with AI: the role will involve collecting, analyzing, and transforming business data into strategic information to support internal decision-making processes. The individual will be responsible for creating reports and dashboards, as well as managing activities and projects to ensure their effective integration into business processes. Additionally, the role will include performing targeted analyses to address specific business needs.

LoJack √® alla ricerca di un candidato per la posizione di Data Analyst con competenze di Intelligenza Artificiale: la figura si occuper√† di raccogliere, analizzare e trasformare i dati aziendali in informazioni strategiche a supporto dei processi decisionali interni e sar√† responsabile della creazione di reportistiche / dashboard e della gestione di attivit√† / progetti per una loro efficace integrazione nei processi aziendali, oltre che della realizzazione di analisi mirate per indirizzare specifiche esigenze di business.

Responsabilit√†


Analyze large volumes of data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and implement AI and machine learning models to optimize business decisions and strategies.
Create data flows for the maintenance and enhancement of the DWH.
Create reports and dashboards to visualize data clearly and comprehensively, and monitor business performance.
Maintain and improve data analysis systems and AI infrastructure.
Collaborate with internal teams to translate analysis results into actionable insights and effective strategies.
Analisi di grandi quantit√† di dati per identificare tendenze, modelli e opportunit√† di miglioramento.
Sviluppo e implementazione di modelli di AI e machine learning per ottimizzare decisioni e strategie aziendali.
Creazione di flussi dati per mantenimento e accrescimento di DWH.
Creazione di report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile e monitorare le performance aziendali.
Manutenzione e miglioramento dei sistemi di analisi dei dati e l‚Äôinfrastruttura AI.
Collaborazione con i team interni per tradurre i risultati dell'analisi in azioni pratiche e strategie efficaci.


Titoli di studio


Technical education: Diploma or degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other scientific fields (Mathematics, Physics, Statistics).
At least 2 years of previous experience in a similar role.
Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Power BI, Salesforce reports and dashboards).
Good knowledge of English (knowledge of Spanish and/or French is a plus).
Cross-functional skills such as problem-solving, flexibility, precision, teamwork, analytical abilities, attention to detail, and organization.
Formazione tecnica: diploma o laurea in informatica o Ingegneria o altre materie scientifiche (Matematica, Fisica, Statistica)
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 2 anni in un ruolo simile
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Power BI, report e cruscotti Salesforce)
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (costituisce un plus la conoscenza della lingua spagnola e/o francese)
Competenze trasversali come problem solving, flessibilit√†, precisione, team working, capacit√† analitiche e orientamento al dettaglio, organizzazione

Title: Analista business intelligence
Description:
IT BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST




Cliente: Azienda di prodotto

Sede: Corsico

Modalit√† di lavoro: Ibrida

RAL: 50-55k







Stiamo cercando un IT Business Intelligence Specialist per un'azienda di prodotto con una lunga tradizione e un forte orientamento all'innovazione. L'azienda opera in diversi settori, tra cui industriale, Food & Beverage, Automotive e Medicale, sviluppando soluzioni tecnologiche di alta qualit√† per il mercato globale.




La posizione, a diretto riporto del CIO, offre l'opportunit√† di contribuire in modo significativo alla gestione e all'analisi dei dati aziendali, supportando la trasformazione digitale e favorendo l'implementazione di strategie avanzate di Business Intelligence.




In che modo, in questo ruolo, potrai avere un impatto tangibile nell'organizzazione?

Collaborare con il CIO nell‚Äôapplicazione delle strategie aziendali e nell‚Äôidentificazione e nello sviluppo delle diverse soluzioni tecnologiche.
Supportare gli stakeholder nell‚Äôindividuazione delle esigenze in termini di reporting e di analisi dei dati aziendali.
Realizzare e gestire il data warehouse aziendale, definendo l‚Äôarchitettura delle basi dati aziendali.
Implementare strumenti di estrazione dati e di reportistica per ottimizzare la gestione delle informazioni aziendali.
Monitorare il corretto funzionamento dei sistemi implementati, garantendone efficienza, performance e qualit√†.
Offrire supporto quotidiano agli utenti finali, assicurandone un utilizzo efficace ed efficiente della piattaforma aziendale di reporting.
Gestire e coordinare i partner tecnologici, assicurando il rispetto dei budget assegnati.
Collaborare con il team IT nell‚Äôimplementazione di soluzioni applicative e partecipare attivamente a progetti di innovazione digitale.




Quali competenze ti serve gi√† possedere?

Esperienza professionale di almeno 4 anni in ruoli simili presso aziende internazionali e/o societ√† di consulenza
Ottima conoscenza di Qlik (Qlik Sense, Qlikview, Nprinting, GeoAnalytics
Ottima conoscenza del linguaggio SQL
Ottima conoscenza di database relazionali: Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle
Buona conoscenza di progettazione Data Warehouse
Buona Esperienza di progetti ERP, con un focus sull‚Äôarea Manufacturing










Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le et√† e tutte le nazionalit√†, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi

215/03 e 216/03.

Title: Stagiaire Data Analyst
HTML:
As we are revamping our BI solutions, we need someone to help us catalog existing dashboards/reports and continuously improve them. The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Business Intelligence team in creating data visualizations and interactive reports for Chanel in the Swiss Markets. This role offers a chance to learn, grow, and contribute to meaningful projects in a dynamic work environment.


  • Conduct an assessment of existing BI solutions, rationalize or harmonize them if necessary.
  • Collaborate with business teams to understand visualization requirements and needs.
  • Assist in the design and the development of Power BI dashboards and reports.
  • Participate in the maintenance and improvement of existing BI solutions.
  • Contribute to the resolution of issues relative to data quality and data consistency across the different sources and global/regional BI solutions
  • Contribute to special projects and continuous improvement initiatives.


Job Profile


  • Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field;
  • Basic knowledge of BI tools, particularly Power BI;
  • Knowledge of SQL language is a plus;
  • Strong interest in the field of Business Intelligence and data analysis;
  • Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively;
  • Proactive and eager to learn and contribute to the team;
  • Proficiency in English and French.


From July 2025;

Based in Geneva

Duration: 6 months

Title: Data Analyst/ML Engineer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Your internship

Join one of the teams building brand new systems with GenAI tools at its core. Drive the strategy for data intelligence by finding insights and grounding product decisions in the real world data. Solve real world problems with agentic AI systems, run large scale evaluations using LLMs and pave the way for the future of Digital Employee Experience. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of AI innovation, equipping you with the skills to make a real-world impact.

What You Will Do


Innovate with Latest Technologies: Conduct research, data analysis and LLM experiments leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, commercial and open source.
Collaborate with Experts: Work closely with AI/ML researchers and software engineers using data insights to help developing and optimizing the state-of-the-art AI applications.
Contribute to Development: Actively participate in evaluation, integration, and deployment of your solution in the nexthink platform.
Communicate Your Insights: Present your findings and recommendations to the team and key stakeholders.


Qualifications


MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, ML or a relevant field
You love working with data and finding patterns and insights.
You are creative and happy to offer new ideas and solutions.
You have a good understanding of LLM technologies, Python data science libraries, SQL.
You are not afraid of software engineering tools: git, docker, AWS.
You have a drive for analytical problems and you like solving challenges, have a good team spirit and are happy to collaborate with the team.
You should also have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Professional level of written and spoken English skills are a must.


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

ü§∏ Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Your internship

Join one of the teams building brand new systems with GenAI tools at its core. Drive the strategy for data intelligence by finding insights and grounding product decisions in the real world data. Solve real world problems with agentic AI systems, run large scale evaluations using LLMs and pave the way for the future of Digital Employee Experience. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of AI innovation, equipping you with the skills to make a real-world impact.

What You Will Do

  • Innovate with Latest Technologies: Conduct research, data analysis and LLM experiments leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, commercial and open source.
  • Collaborate with Experts: Work closely with AI/ML researchers and software engineers using data insights to help developing and optimizing the state-of-the-art AI applications.
  • Contribute to Development: Actively participate in evaluation, integration, and deployment of your solution in the nexthink platform.
  • Communicate Your Insights: Present your findings and recommendations to the team and key stakeholders.

Qualifications

  • MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, ML or a relevant field
  • You love working with data and finding patterns and insights.
  • You are creative and happy to offer new ideas and solutions.
  • You have a good understanding of LLM technologies, Python data science libraries, SQL.
  • You are not afraid of software engineering tools: git, docker, AWS.
  • You have a drive for analytical problems and you like solving challenges, have a good team spirit and are happy to collaborate with the team.
  • You should also have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Professional level of written and spoken English skills are a must.

Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

üìç Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

üè° Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

ü§∏ Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

üçâ Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

ü§ù Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst
HTML:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.


‚ÄúRethink Everything‚Äù is our philosophy ‚Äì it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.


Data and Reporting Analyst (Geneva, Switzerland)


We report on the evolution of LOIM‚Äôs Financials (Assets under Management, Revenues and Costs) to various internal and external stakeholders. We manage LOIM‚Äôs revenue processes and implement LOIM‚Äôs transfer pricing policies. We provide Financial Planning and Analysis to LOIM‚Äôs business lines and to the Lombard Odier Group.


YOUR ROLE


  • Develop, maintain and run workflows that prepare data and ensure data quality for facts and dimensions feeding our dashboards and reports;
  • Collaborate with our internal data providers (IT, Operations, Business Dev) in projects, production and troubleshooting;
  • Produce, maintain and upgrade dashboards, reports and ad-hoc analysis intended for Senior Management, Investment teams, Business Development;
  • Participate to the preparation of Revenue forecasts;
  • Drive various projects, e.g. improvement of existing data management processes, design dashboards that address new business requirements, integrate new data sources;


YOUR PROFILE


  • 3-5 years of experience in a similar role;
  • Experience working with large datasets and building reports for various stakeholders
  • Strong technical skills, including experience with Alteryx and Tableau, Microsoft office (Excel/Access, VBA), Cognos ReportNet a plus;
  • Genuine interest for the financial industry and investment products;
  • Technically minded and detail oriented with strong conceptual and problem solving skills;
  • Organized, ability to progress on multiple concurrent tasks with autonomy;
  • Team player with good communication skills;
  • Very good written and spoken English and French;
  • Residence in Switzerland.


Our Maison‚Äôs DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

As a responsible and supportive employer, we promote a diverse and inclusive work environment for our employees and candidates. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are woven into the fabric of our Maison‚Äôs DNA, and we strive to ensure that our employees can fulfill both their personal and professional aspirations by encouraging internal mobility and individual upskilling programs. We firmly believe that building Diverse Teams contributes to our successes and to deliver on this, we actively embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in our business strategy.


It is an exciting time to join our Teams. All applications will be handled in the strictest confidence.
